page.title: 03FARMING IN ARMSWORTH
page.content: Farming in the Armsworth Valley. Entering the valley one finds farmland on either side of the road, with high ancient hedges and a wide verge. Fields of winter wheat and two large fields of grass grown for seed.Further up barley and more wheat. By Lanham Farm a large herd of cross bred cows and their calves graze old permanent pasture under the watchful eye of a Charollais bull. After the turning to Godsfield some farmworkers cottages lie back from the road. One pair has been converted into a private house. Opposite is Lower Lanham Copse part of which is copsed every winter. Further up on either side more wheat, some barley and an occasional field of oil seed rape, vining peas, broadbeans and a field of oats. Some calves bought for beef and reared in barns.
